definitions.definition: A reaction that takes place in gelatinized starch when the amylose and amylopectin chains realign themselves, largely responsible for bread becoming stale .
examples: The major reason that bread stales is not moisture loss, but rather a process called retrogradation , in which the starch molecules in the bread crystallize.

secondary_definitions: ( chemistry ) A reaction that takes place in gelatinized starch when the amylose and amylopectin chains realign themselves, largely responsible for bread becoming stale .
